fields.summary: Create an icon glossary within Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5813].
  {panel}

I would like to create an easy link to a label within a space or within a site.

For example to list all pages with a particular label, I would like to write something akin to the [^attatchment.txt] or [#anchor] or [term@shortcut] or [$idref] notation.

Perhaps [SpaceKey:pagetitle!mylabel] (where SpaceKet is the space key, pagetitle is the page title and mylabel is the label I want to link to within the space/page)

Currently I can hard-code the URL as such: [mylabel|http://confluenceserver.com/label/spacekey/mylabel]

Thanks!
fields.summary: Create a link to a label

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5808].
  {panel}

In previous versions of Confluence, Space Administrators could access the "Layout" page in "Space Administration" to edit the Space Theme manually (the Velocity files specifically). It appears that at some point after Confluence 2.0 this ability was removed due to security concerns but the documentation was not updated at the time. I ran into this and filed the following bug at http://support.atlassian.com -- CSP-3044.

~~~~~~~~~~~

I had a call from a Space Administrator today who was trying to modify the custom decorators for a space per these instructions.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Working+with+Custom+Decorators

However, he couldn't view the "Layout" link in the "Look and Feel" section of the "Space Administration" page (he only had 3 items there rather than 4). To test, I created a user, gave it space administration privileges and verified I couldn't see the "Layout" link. Interestingly enough, my regular user which has full Confluence Administration privileges ("Administrate Confluence" in "Global Permissions") could see the "Layout" link in "Space Administration".

Some further testing showed that the only users who can see the "Layout" button in the "Space Administration" page are those with full "Administrate Confluence" privileges.

Since the documentation above says "You need to be a space administrator to edit decorator files." I'm presuming this is a bug and hope it can be easily/quickly fixed.

I also tried to manually go to the layout link as a space administrator user and was denied with a "You are not permitted to perform this operation." message.

Thanks for your help. 

~~~~~~~~~

The response was that "Unfortunately it is a security risk to allow space administrators to put arbitrary velocity markup in layouts -- they could escalate their priviledges to those of the global administrator."

I then noted that the docs were incorrect and asked if this had changed recently....the answer was "At one time they could. The ideal solution would be to make sure that a 'bad' layout can't produce a security problem, but that's hard. You can raise a feature request for more granular permissions at http://jira.atlassian.com and we will consider it. ".

So....I'm making a feature request here that Space Administrators could selectively be allowed to edit the Layout files (Velocity files). I'm not very picky as to whether it's a global Confluence preference (i.e. all Space Administrators can edit Layout files) or an extra Space permissions.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow Space Administrators Access to the Space Layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5806].
  {panel}

The addition of adding change comments and indication of minor updates was a good idea but it is not used very effectively.  One reason is that this information isn't readily visible and used regularly.  The suggestion would be to include mouse over text on each place that has a "view changes" link that would indicate:
1) Minor update or note
2) Change comment
Once this information becomes more visible to users, its more likely people will start putting in useful information.
fields.summary: View change mouse over could show change comment
Delete Lucence lock files on startup
Ability to sort search results
Ability to specify the the maximum results per page for search results
Thumbnails: determine size of new window
Syntax Highlighting Wiki Markup
Improve performance of XML backup and restore
Option for {attachments} macro: sortbyfield=xy, reverse=true|false
Allow the excerpt-include macro to work across spaces
Shorten RSS URLs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5740].
  {panel}

Guy Fraser on conf-user:

Yup, the somewhat odd "Advanced" tab. Everything about that tab seems a little odd - it's almost like an "Other Stuff that doesn't quite fit anywhere else so we had to stick it here" tab.

Could a "watch space" icon be placed on the spaces list? So just as you can click the star to add the space to your favourites, you could click an envelope to watch the space.

The orphaned / undefined pages could possibly go to the Browse Space > Pages tab?

With what's left could the "Advanced" tab then be renamed to "Export" or something similar?
fields.summary: Improve Advanced tab in Browse Space
Make groups sortable
Export a space as it existed on a specified date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5728].
  {panel}

Currently the addition of a child page does not trigger a page-change notification to people subscribed to the parent.  It would be nice if this could be considered worthy of notification.

* A new page version is not needed, but a special "Child added to page" mail would/could be nice.
* Only the addition of direct child pages should cause a notification to avoid notification insanity.
* Something like this might be a good user option to add - "Consider creation of direct child-pages worthy of change notification"
fields.summary: Make adding a child page trigger an e-mail to people subscribed to the parent
Enhance {vote} macro to track voters' information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5721].
  {panel}

A customer has requested the ability to have a user profile search screen which allows one to search across the fields of a user profile including any custom fields that may be added if the custom user profile feature is added to Confluence.

This screen would list all fields that one could search across and include multi-select lists for any drop down menu options that may be included in any custom user profiles.

This way users could search for other users based on variables such as:

 - name
 - region (country/state/city)
 - industry
 - interests

This would be great for community based sites (helping people find and connect with others) which is a a great use cases for wikis.
fields.summary: Create user profile search screen - include support for customised user profiles
Build a Microsoft Sharepoint importer
Add horizontal scroll bar to wiki markup editor
Comments tab under the "Browse Space" page
RSS/Atom display of updated entries
Use PagePicker instead of select box on edit space screen
Section headers for left bar navigation should be fully clickable
Borders on {section} tags should collapse
LinkManager.getIncomingLinksToContent should return links found in comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5672].
  {panel}

Currently, there are a bunch of things that are global options that would make more sense at the space level, including but not limited to:

* CamelCase linking
* Trackback
* Threaded comments
* Rich Text Editor prefs
* Maximum attachment size
* Macro availability

In each case, the global setting should be considered the default. Additionally global administrators should be able to 'lock' a setting so it can not be overridden -- use the mnemonic of an open or closed padlock next to the setting? (For the "attachment size" setting, the lock should mean that the size setting can't be exceeded, but maybe space admins can still set a lower size?)
fields.summary: Move global configuration options to the space level where relevant
Allow RSS subscriptions to individual pages
Use version of osuser which requires fewer LDAP permissions
Index repositories external to the Confluence core database (content, files, emails).
Add email mailing list functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5640].
  {panel}

A customer has requested the ability to rate pages.

Although there is a rating plugin, this allows one to rate anything i.e. you could have multiple ratings on a single page. What we need though is the ability to just rate the page itself - a page rating.

With a specific page rating we want the ability to not just rate the page but to be able to browse by rating or be able to embed a list of pages sorted by rating, or display a specific list of pages according to their specific rating (i.e. all pages rated 4).

1 - 5 seems still like an appropriate scale. The current plugin rating should be reviewed when implementing this.
fields.summary: Add ability to rate pages
Hide comments completely from certain users (add a hide comments permission?)
Notation guide needs updating with new styles for user links and broken links
Streamline comment style so that each comment takes up less vertical height
Preserve Parent and Space information on Historical Versions of pages
Original page in PageUpdateEvent/PageRemoveEvent lacks of Space definition
"Double click starts editing" a per-user preference?
Export news (blog posts) to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5572].
  {panel}

Confluence stores history of pages and attachments already. To see a specific old page or an attachment  you need to go to a specific page.

It would be extremely useful if it was possible to:
1. Define a point in time and walk the space as it was on that time in the psat, including all deleted pages, and older version of pages and attachments, etc. Similar to source control system capabilities. 
This is very useful when you use confluence for software project development, because if I want to see a documentation of an old version then of a software I can't. Once changes made I am in troubles.

2. Give a label to a point in time (let's call it a view) and do #1 based on the label.

3. Allow seeing under a specific space the set of "views" that are available based on labels defined in #2.

Bottom line - take a look at source control systems and bring features from there. The more you bring the better. 

That would be an awsome capability.
fields.summary: Ability to work with a historical version of a space - source control like functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5566].
  {panel}

Confluence sends daily notifications which is a GREAT and very important feature of the product. This is what actually push the knowlege to users.

In an environment of many spaces and active wiki the amount of information is large and only some of the spaces are of interest to a user.

The user should be able to customize the list of spaces for which he receives notification.

It could be in addition to the current daily notifications. So when you don't have time you delete the full and read only the personal while when you have time you go over the full.

The personal one could be based on the spaces the user selected as interesting (this is a feature already exists in Confluence 2.1.x).
fields.summary: Personalized daily notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5565].
  {panel}

Confluence 2.1.x has nice labeling capabilities.

However the search capabilities of those labels are quite poor and inconvinient using labelText:<label>.

For Confluence to server as a strong knowledge base all is needed it the ability to search based on labels (in the context of a space):
1. use label:label1,label2,label3 in the search string
2. GUI that will allow selecting (using checkbox) from the list of all labels.
fields.summary: Enhance Label Search and allow Confluence to server as a strong Knowledge Base
When viewing a historical page, menu items should take you to info about the old page rather than the current page
add export single page as PDF to remote API
Search results for pages with the HTML macro should show the text in the summary, not the HTML markup
Ability to limit the size of each entry in an RSS feed
Google sitemaps support
Add option to exportSpace remote API to allow save to the backups folder
Add restoreSpace and restoreSite to remote API
Access in page.pdfexport.vm the full user name instead of the login name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5467].
  {panel}

Looks like error handling changed for images around 2.x.  If an image attachment was not found, it use to just show an missing image box.  Now it shows a red error message.  This looks ugly if you were using the missing image as a place holder.  We have just migrated a bunch of pages that use to look fine with missing images and now look ugly.  For things like this and other similar cases, error handling could be improved.  On one hand you want to show the author problems when they are creating or modifying a page.  On the other hand, we don't want end users who look at pages to see ugly error messages.   Have you considered other options for error handling?
> 1) mouse over text showing error text ?
> 2) separate info area that shows error details ?
> 3) error tab ?
Generally speaking, errors that are not that critical and may be left in the text on purpose should present in a way that is ok to look at.  For example, red highlighted area (but no error message).  I think there are examples of this today.
fields.summary: Error reporting for images not found
Remember state in tree view
Page comparison should indicate name changes
Reduce memory required to serve each request
Showing accessible  Spaces when assigning Groups to Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5436].
  {panel}

A customer was complaining about the error message that appears in Confluence if the user does not have permissions to view the content included via an include. As such:

# Can we please add a flag to the include macro so that the error message can be turned off so that the page will render seamlessly (with no error messages) regardless of the include existing and the viewers permissions.

*Alternative Simple Solution*
# Can Confluence can handle this warning with a more friendly message  (e.g. You do not have permission to view this page.)

We also  need to make note of this in the Confluence documentation - in the user guide I'd suggest.
fields.summary: Add capability to turn off include error message and make note of this in Conf user guide/admin guide docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5317].
  {panel}

There is a bug with this macro when used in IE 6 (with most recent patches).
Repro:
1. Use {dynamictasklist} in a page.
2. Add a task
3. Click on del to delete the task
Current Behavior:
The circular arrow shows up and it keeps rolling and then gets stuck. The only way to get past it is to refresh the page.

Expected Behavior:
Just like in firefox, the arrow should show up, the task should get deleted and everything should be good.
fields.summary: dynamictasklist macro delete fails on IE
Review page changes as side-by-side comparison
Add font selection capabilities to WYSIWYG editing and Wiki markup modes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5302].
  {panel}

Atlassians,

As per my understanding, right now user management is completely done by confluence administrators.
Hence very simple task like creating user account, adding them to different user groups for any space; can be done by only by confluence administrator.

I was wondering is it possible to delegate this task to Space Administrator as those are right guys to take decision on whom they want to add to their space and if they want to users to specific user-groups. As a Confluence Administrator, I don't want to spend my time in doing these time consuming tasks for hundreds of spaces, when space admins are better suited to do that.

Any idea when such kind of feature will be available ? Please let's know.

{panel}
*Current* options as suggested by Atlassian [Comment by David Soul on 22nd Oct]:

1. Install the Custom Space User Management (CSUM) Plugin to allow space administrators to manage users at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Custom+Space+User+Management+Plugin

*At last I end up in developing this CSUM plugin (version 1.0). Version 2.0 (currently rc3 release) is much better with many requested features and better UI with very active contributions from Gary, Ren, Andy*

2. Install the Invite Plugin to allow space administrators to invite users by email from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Invite+Plugin

3. Use external user management such as LDAP or Active Directory and allow space administrator to grant users through there

4. Grant site administration rights

5. Grant site admin rights to a specific user and ask space admins to delegate their user administration tasks to this person
{panel}

thanks,
Rajendra
fields.summary: User management delegation to Space Admins
Ability for news items to be posted at a certain date/time
Allow user profiles to be customised
"Insert Image"-window in the page editor should show multimedia attachments, not just images

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5254].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary
In some cases, it's possible for two labels to be created with the same name (even though we do checks for this). It can occur when there are two parallel requests (via the web or XML-RPC), which try to add the same (non-existent) label. Since they're in separate transactions, it's not possible to see that another session is trying to create the label, so both end up in the DB.

For example, new labels can be created via API using the [add labels to content API endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content-labels/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-label-post]. If users use this API endpoint multiple times and fast enough, and no label exists at the start of the execution of their script, then multiple labels will be created with the same name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a script that calls the above end point very quickly or in parallel for multiple pieces of content and using the same label name.
# Run the script

h3. Expected Results
One label is created and is associated with all content

h3. Actual Results
Multiple labels are created with the same name. It seems to be random which content gets which duplicate, but typically one label will have the most associations.

This can be confirmed by using the Label List macro and noting that multiple labels are listed with the same name.

h3. Workaround
If duplicate labels have been created:
# Remove these labels from all content either manually or by utilizing [the remove label from content API endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content-labels/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-label-label-delete].
# Add the labels back either manually or by utilizing the [add labels to content API endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content-labels/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-label-post]. Since the label exists by the time these requests are received, only one label will be used this time, regardless of the speed of the API calls.

The above process will ensure that all labels have one and only one label, rather than any duplicate label.

To prevent this issue from happening in the future, for each new label to be created, make sure that the label exists first (either via UI or one API call), then subsequent calls will use the already created label regardless of the speed at which those calls are created.

h3. Possible solutions to this

Write a periodic task that merges any duplicate labels (and the affected content)
Isolate the sections of the current transaction in the save process, to narrow the window in which this can occur
Add some sort of read/write filtering to the transaction so the changes can be seen before the transaction ends
fields.summary: Duplicate labels can be created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5251].
  {panel}

fields.summary: Update components - commons-digester, commons-lang
Dynamic Task List - Adding Date to Completion data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5186].
  {panel}

The idea behind space channels is relatively simple in terms of concept, but probably quite a lot of work in terms of implementation.

Labels allow us to easily tag content, effectively categorising it. However, it seems there is still one component missing that would tie up lots of loose ends such as:

* Namespaces
* Spaces within spaces (eg. for dealing with permissions across blocks of content in a space)
* Permissions (see above)
* etc.

NOTE: I know that what follows could essentially be done with multiple spaces, however there are many times when it's not practical or desirable to do so, hence the channels idea.

The channels idea works as follows:

1. A space admin can create one or more channels (there would likely be a default channel for all content).

2. For each channel, the space admin can select what privileges are assigned to groups/users/anon for that channel - eg. who can edit content in that channel.

3. Ideally, the space admin should also be able to define what macros/templates can be used within a channel. Being able to have an email archive per channel would also be highly useful.

A default channel would be used to deal with old content - eg. when you upgrade to the version of Confluence that has channels, everything gets put in to the default channel for each space (pages, templates, mail archive, space permissions). Due to this default channel, you'd instantly then be able to define what macros can be used in a space.

Now, let's say you want a team (user group) to be able to edit one section of a space and not another - simply create a new channel and assign the privs, etc.

Pages would then have a channel drop-down (a page can only be in one channel).  You would obviously need a "Change channel" permission somewhere. Any pages created that are attached to a parent page would automatically inherit the parent page's channel - for most users (who cannot "change channel") they would be none the wiser as the option would not be available (the applicable channel would merely be displayed as text) = keeps things simple for them.  So, from an editing point of view, there's not too much work involved.

You would not be able to move pages outside of a given channel - someone with "change channel" priv would have to do that for you = nice container allowing orgnaisations to contain content for a given channel within that channel.

As mentioned earlier, each channel could have it's own mail archive and templates.  The mail archive is particularly interesting as you would then have the ability for teams to work side by side in a space, each with their own archive.

Templates should be able to be in all channels, one channel or several channels - eg. if you want to share a common template with all channels in a space.

You could search by channel.  You could export a channel (eg. to Word = great for documentation, etc). You could get an RSS feed for the channel.

Being able to set permissions and what macros can be used in a channel means that different groups with different experience and privileges/needs can be more effectively "boxed in" within a space.

Comments?
fields.summary: Space Channels - insane idea or inspired idea?
Ability to view pages in trash
support team labels in the rss feed builder
Confirm page for restoration of spaces/site from backup
Add the "Full screen" option to the Wiki markup editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5110].

2) Display users who are watching

3) Click to add users with view permission to list of watchers
fields.summary: Display users with view permission and users who are watching; assign watching

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5108].
  {panel}

Currently, the only way to setup Confluence is either to:

1) Run through the web-based setup
2) Manually generate a valid confluence home directory

The second is complicated by the fact that you can't plonk a license into confluence.cfg.xml and expect it to work.

Dan Hardiker in an email:

> Ideally I would like to be able to replace the setup script with an automated version. Having it pull from a file put in a 
> system property (e.g. -Dconfluence.setup.config=/path/to/confluence-setup.properties) with the ability to set a URL 
> to navigate to once setup has completed would enable us to leave confluence to set itself up automatically, and then 
> have it directed to our xwork plugin to deal with setting up anything custom.

Maybe instead of a system property (which can cause problems if you forget to remove it next time you start up, have Confluence check if the confluence-home directory is (a) without a confluence-cfg.xml, and (b) contains a setup.properties file. If so, do the setup from setup.properties and then delete the properties file.
fields.summary: Non-interactive setup
Page edit permissions should be inherited by pages, like view permissions are
Create a JotSpot importer.
All labelling of mail items
Add ability to filter mail and move between spaces

fields.description: The only publicly accessible part of my wiki is the "Contact Administrators" page. These emails aren't encrypted, and even if they are "masked" they are very easy to read by spambots. Stronger encryption, such as available at http://automaticlabs.com/products/enkoderform/ would be a great benefit. I don't mind logged in users seeing my plain-text email, but I'd like to be able to configure the public page differently. Thanks for your work.,
fields.summary: Email addresses in "Contact Administrators Link" should be encrypted by default
Missing License Should Prompt For License Key Entry
